title: 112_hr3484
content: The "Travel Regional Investment Partnership Act" recognizes the significance of the travel and tourism industry, highlighting its economic impact and the need for public-private partnerships to promote domestic regional tourism growth. The Act also establishes a Domestic Regional Tourism Grant Program. The Secretary will establish a grant program through the Office of Travel and Tourism Industries to promote domestic regional tourism growth. Grants will range from $100,000 to $1,000,000 and can be awarded to State tourism offices, local destination marketing organizations, and partnerships between governments and tourism entities. Priority may be given to regions with low tourism marketing contributions, maintaining regional diversity, and benefiting rural destinations. The grant program aims to promote domestic regional tourism growth by awarding grants to various entities for tourist promotion activities. Eligible entities must submit an application to the Secretary detailing the activities to be funded by the grant. Priority is given to regions with low tourism marketing contributions, maintaining regional diversity, and benefiting rural destinations. The grant program requires eligible entities to submit an application detailing tourist promotion activities to be funded. For partnerships with State or local governments and tourism entities, specific tourist entities, partnership details, impact on regional tourism, and job creation must be provided. Non-federal funds matching requirement is also necessary for grant receipt. The partnership must demonstrate the impact on job creation and provide non-Federal matching funds for the grant. Reports on travel-generated expenditures, tax receipts, and employment must be submitted annually. Definitions include "local tourist entity." The section authorizes $10,000,000 for grants over 5 years for travel-related businesses. Definitions include "local tourist entity" and "Secretary."
